# The `Constants.h` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This file contains the declarations for the subclasses of Constant, which represent the different flavors of constant values that live in LLVM. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This file contains the declarations for the subclasses of Constant, which represent the different flavors of constant values that live in LLVM.

Note that Constants are immutable (once created they never change) and are fully shared by structural equivalence. This means that two structurally equivalent constants will always have the same address. Constants are created on demand as needed and never deleted: thus clients don&#39;t have to worry about the lifetime of the objects.

<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return the constant as an llvm::MaybeAlign.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ConstantDataSequential - A vector or array constant whose element type is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// simple 1/2/4/8-byte integer or half/bfloat/float/double, and whose elements</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// are just simple data values (i.e. ConstantInt/ConstantFP).  This Constant</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// node has no operands because it stores all of the elements of the constant</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// as densely packed data, instead of as Value&#42;&#39;s.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is the common base class of ConstantDataArray and ConstantDataVector.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdatasequential"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdatasequential/#affe367e75e60cf8dfdb8f501d15eff91">ConstantDataSequential</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdata/#ade3ec5a4a86ffd069698509c87b6a604">ConstantData</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdatasequential/#aa81f87de855d80e4275071841a7e0c83"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">friend</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdatasequential/#aa81f87de855d80e4275071841a7e0c83">LLVMContextImpl</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdatasequential/#a5bd16c2fbe755cda66b18d56761038ea"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">friend</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdatasequential/#a5bd16c2fbe755cda66b18d56761038ea">Constant</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A pointer to the bytes underlying this constant (which is owned by the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// uniquing StringMap).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;DataElements;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This forms a link list of ConstantDataSequential nodes that have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the same value but different type.  For example, 0,0,0,1 could be a 4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// element array of i8, or a 1-element array of i32.  They&#39;ll both end up in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the same StringMap bucket, linked up.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;ConstantDataSequential&gt; Next;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00691" /><CodeLine lineNumber="691"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// An array constant whose element type is a simple 1/2/4/8-byte integer or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00692" /><CodeLine lineNumber="692"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// float/double, and whose elements are just simple data values</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="693"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (i.e. ConstantInt/ConstantFP). This Constant node has no operands because it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="694"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// stores all of the elements of the constant as densely packed data, instead</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="695"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of as Value&#42;&#39;s.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="696" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdataarray"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight">ConstantDataArray final : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantdataarray/#a74958cbd34e1860b1a7c946af159cbb4">ConstantDataSequential</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A constant value that is initialized with an expression using</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// other constant values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class uses the standard Instruction opcodes to define the various</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// constant expressions.  The Opcode field for the ConstantExpr class is</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1403"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#39;undef&#39; values are things that do not have specified contents.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1404"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// These are used for a variety of purposes, including global variable</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1411"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
